intro: Pentacme paucinervis, commonly known as the slender-veined pentacme, is a herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite, and often lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbellate clusters, typical of its family. Its fruits are berries that mature to a dark purple color, containing several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
